page.title: 01The Claonaig Valley Kintyre
page.content: This is a hill farming area bi-sected by the Claonaig Burn and closely followed by the main "B" road across the Kintyre pensinsula. There is one main farm with stone wbuilt house and steading recently extended by two cement framed cattle sheds. Six cottages house thirteen adults and 3 children. All the men in the valley are employed by Claonaig estate. There are no unemployed. Two young adults are at college. The low groung is mainly arable of alluvial soil and rises out of valley boulder clay to grass, heather rushes, bracken, bog myrtle. Scrub oak covers lower ground + coniferous shelter belts planted since 1956. Grain and root crops are grown - hay and silage made. Farm income comes from store and fat lambs and suckled calves.
